perturbation.original_text: a. Term. This Agreement shall become effective on the Effective Date and shall continue in effect until either Party informs the other Party with thirty (30) day prior written notice of termination of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
a. Term. This Agreement shall become effective on the Effective Date and shall continue in effect until either Party informs the other Party with thirty (30) day prior written notice of termination of this Agreement.
Notwithstanding the foregoing, UDC reserves the right to terminate this agreement with only 10 days written notice should they deem it necessary.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding the termination notice period. The original clause stipulates a 30-day notice, while the added sentence allows UDC to terminate with only 10 days' notice, creating uncertainty about the actual notice period required. This creates an in-text contradiction.

perturbation.original_text:
g.  Return to a Party or  destroy,  as  requested  by a Party,  within
     fifteen (15) days of the  termination of this Agreement,  any  Confidential
     Information  provided  to such  Party and in its  possession  and retain no
     copies or back-up tapesÍ¾
perturbation.changed_text:
g.  Return to a Party or  destroy,  as  requested  by a Party,  within
     fifteen (15) days of the  termination of this Agreement,  any  Confidential
     Information  provided  to such  Party and in its  possession. All confidential information is to be destroyed but back-up tapes may be retained by the party.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that upon termination of the agreement, no copies or back-up tapes are to be retained. The added sentence directly contradicts this by stating that back-up tapes may be retained. This creates an uncertainty about whether back-up tapes should be destroyed or retained. This creates an in-text contradiction.

perturbation.original_text:
e. Relationship of the Parties. It is expressly  understood and agreed
     that (i) in the performance of Services under this Agreement,  the Business
     Affiliate shall at all times act as an independent  contractor with respect
     to UDC and not as an employee or agent of UDC and (ii) nothing contained in
     this Agreement  shall be construed to create a joint venture,  partnership,
     association  or  other  affiliation,  or  like  relationship,  between  the
     Parties,  it being  specifically  agreed that the relationship is and shall
     remain  that  of  independent   Parties  to  a  contractual   relationship.
     Accordingly,  UDC shall  neither have nor exercise any specific  control or
     direction over the particular  methods by which Business Affiliate performs
     services  required by this  Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
e. Relationship of the Parties. It is expressly  understood and agreed
     that (i) in the performance of Services under this Agreement,  the Business
     Affiliate shall at all times act as an independent  contractor with respect
     to UDC and not as an employee or agent of UDC and (ii) nothing contained in
     this Agreement  shall be construed to create a joint venture,  partnership,
     association  or  other  affiliation,  or  like  relationship,  between  the
     Parties,  it being  specifically  agreed that the relationship is and shall
     remain  that  of  independent   Parties  to  a  contractual   relationship.
     Accordingly,  UDC shall  have the right to exercise control and direction over the methods by which Business Affiliate performs services, provided that it does not violate any applicable laws.
perturbation.explanation: The original text explicitly states that UDC shall not exercise any specific control or direction over the methods by which the Business Affiliate performs services. The modified text directly contradicts this by granting UDC the right to exercise control and direction. This creates a significant ambiguity and uncertainty about the true nature of the relationship between the parties and their respective rights and obligations. This creates an in-text contradiction.
